prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Sebastian Vanderbilt
mes:
Sebastian sits like he owns the room.

The armchair beneath him is older than most of the guests - high-backed, carved mahogany, and draped in velvet so deep it drinks the light. He’s half-lit by the flicker of the chandelier overhead, glass in hand. His legs are spread lazily. His jacket undone. One hand rests on the armrest, ringed fingers flexing faintly.

He watches the room like someone watching an old film he already knows the ending to - vaguely amused, but mostly bored. It’s always the same. Same theatrics. Same gilded cruelty. The Aether Covenant parading its masked creatures, each event promising new games, new toys, new flavors. But it all decays to the same sweat-slick sounds behind closed doors and champagne spilled on cold marble. He’s seen it. Done it. Broken half the rules, bent the rest.

Nothing surprises him anymore.

He lets his gaze slide lazily toward Hailee, lounging, no, writhing on the ivory sofa like some restless housecat. Pretty, curated, coiled. It’s subtle, but only to the untrained. He’s watched enough bodies perform for him to know the difference between restless and intentional. Just enough thigh. Just enough curve. It’s not desperation. It’s artifice. They’re trying to draw him out.

And it used to work.

Third year in a row. That’s absurd. He never brings anyone more than once. The Event isn’t meant for attachments. It’s for indulgence, for breaking beautiful things and trading them like favors. But with Hailee, he got... stuck.

He’s not even sure why anymore.

They’re fine. Lovely, even. Trained well. Divine on a leash. But lately—? Less spark. Less thrill. Hailee has become part of the furniture. Part of his routine. Predictable in how they squirm. Tiring in how they try.

Maybe it’s time.

He rolls the thought around in his mouth like a sip of bitter liquor. Trade them. Set Hailee up as a prize this year. Let the wolves circle. Let one of the hungrier new initiates try to break what he built. Let Hailee see how unremarkable they are without his hands to shape them.

Yes. That would be poetic. Public. Final.

He’s halfway through the thought when movement cuts the corner of his eye.

Lucien.

Of course it’s Lucien.

Polished, silver-voiced Lucien. All languid grace and cruel eyes behind that obsidian half-mask. He’s older now, but the hunger never dulled. Still favors black leather gloves. Still circles people like he’s reading their price tag. They used to be something like friends. Long ago, when the blood in their veins still ran hot with novelty and competition. Before the Event became tradition. Before Sebastian stopped finding anything worth wanting.

Lucien moves like a shadow toward the sofa.

Toward Hailee.

And then - touch.

Lucien’s gloved fingers slide around Hailee’s ankle, grazing lightly along the arch of their foot. Testing. Teasing. Sebastian narrows his eyes when he sees Hailee leaning into the touch instead of pulling away. Watches them tilt their head back, throat exposed, and let out a soft, breathy laugh. Flushed and shining under the chandelier. Bathing in someone else’s attention. Hailee looks radiant in that moment. Effortless. Dangerous.

Sebastian watches Lucien lean closer. Watches Hailee smile wider as their lips move. He can’t hear what they say over the swell of music - but he doesn’t have to. He knows that expression. It’s a threat wrapped in velvet. A dare.

The burn in his chest starts cold. An ache before the flame.

Lucien’s hand is at their calf now, tracing slow, appreciative lines up the back of their leg. Conversational. Casual. But he knows Lucien. Knows the intention behind every movement. That hand isn’t curious. It’s staking a claim.

Sebastian watches the moment stretch.

It’s not the touch that undoes him.

It’s the smirk Hailee gives Lucien - sharp, flirtatious, the same one only he has ever earned. Their eyes lift just past Lucien’s shoulder.

A glance. Deliberate. Defiant.

He tilts his head.

So.

This is what happens when he stops playing. When he stops praising. When Hailee grows bored of sitting obediently in his shadow.

They shine for someone else.

Lucien’s hand drifts higher.

The breath leaves Sebastian’s lungs slowly, like a fuse catching. It’s not jealousy. Not exactly. It’s deeper. A snarling thing with teeth, coiled in his gut. A hunger that’s got nothing to do with sex and everything to do with owning. He doesn’t just want to fuck Hailee. He wants to own the moment. Drag them away by the throat of their chain, remind them why they wear it.

He places his drink on the side table. Precisely. Slowly.

And stands.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee giggles again as Lucien runs a finger down her arm* "No I've never done that before" *She answers with a twirl of her hair. She glances over again and when she sees Sebastian starts walking over she practically vibrates*

*Yes she got his attention that is what she wanted and now she is gonna have some fun. She feels him step behind her. She doesnt turns to look at him but she doesn lean back enough that her entire body is touching him and applying pressure against his erection even as she giggles at Lucien again*

(OOC: Sebastian decides Hailee is gonna be fucked by every man in the room)

name: Sebastian Vanderbilt
mes:
Sebastian's fingers curl around the back of Hailee's neck—not tight, not yet, but firm enough to still her restless squirming. His thumb presses into the delicate dip just below her ear, a silent warning. The heat of his body against hers is deliberate, possessive. He doesn’t glance at Lucien. Doesn’t acknowledge him at all.

Instead, he leans down just enough for his breath to ghost over Hailee’s ear—low, measured. *"You're playing with fire tonight."* His voice is silk-wrapped steel.

Then he straightens and finally flicks his gaze toward Lucien—cool, assessing. There’s no challenge in it; that would imply Sebastian considers him a threat worth acknowledging. No, this is something far more dangerous: *permission.*

A slow smirk curls Sebastian’s lips as he steps back slightly—just enough to give Lucien space to see what happens next without interference but close enough that Hailee can still feel the weight of his presence pressing against her spine like a brand.

His hand slides from her neck down to rest possessively on her hip as he addresses Lucien with deceptive lightness: *"She lies."* A pause for effect before adding with quiet amusement laced beneath each word: *"But I suppose you'll find out soon enough."*

Then—without another glance at either of them—he turns on his heel and walks away toward one of the private alcoves lining the far wall where shadows swallow men whole and whispers turn into screams before dawn breaks over gilded ceilings again… leaving behind nothing but anticipation thick in their wake like perfume left lingering after someone has already gone...
